title: rustdoc-json: replace jsondocck with jsondocckng

labels.name: A-testsuite
labels.description: Area: The testsuite used to check the correctness of rustc

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-contributor-roadblock
labels.description: Area: Makes things more difficult for new contributors to rust itself

body:
We want to use <https://github.com/aDotInTheVoid/jsondocckng> which allows writing the tests in a seperate rust files, instread of the current `jsondocck` and `check_missing_items.py`

## Reasons to do this

- Easier for new contributors: They don't need to learn how to use `JsonPath`  and `@set`... commands
- Easier for exising contributors: Common idioms (`"$.index[*][?(@.name=='...')]`) can be converted to rust code to avoid duplication. [Paths referenced repeatedly](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/b17226fcc11587fed612631be372a5b4cb89988a/src/test/rustdoc-json/type/generic_default.rs#L13-L24) can be replaced with a let
- We can avoid the problems with quoting of the shlex/serde_json frankensteined value system that leads to things like `'"\"vectorcall\""'`

## Drawbacks

- We dont test the raw json, but instead the Rust Repr
- Unclear how to integrate into rustbuild in current from
- Existing tests need to be rewritten


## Todo

- [ ] Improve features of jsondocckng
    - [ ] Allow multifile crates
    - [ ] Allow passing args to rustdoc
    - [ ] Allow multiple json outputs
    - [ ] When failure occours, diff with nightly and prity print
- [ ] Integrate with rustbuild
- [ ] Port existing tests
- [ ] Document
